content.description:
Climb the diagonal seam starting at Nature Nookie/Finger Blast, finish off the diagonal with an interesting mantle and continue up the vertical crack/seam. Lower off.

*This climb avoids the direct start with 5 rivets and 1 bolt. All clean gear from bottom to top.
content.protection: super-tiny to 2.5 inches include offset cams, offset stoppers, and RPs. 2-bolt anchor with rings.
content.location: This is the most conspicuous line in the area- a crack system and water streak that resembles a peace sign or hands on the face of a clock. The approach trail tops out below this route.

content.description: Face climbing with 4 bolts leads to a gear protected crack. Old school. Lower off.
content.protection: to 2.5 inches, 4 protection bolts. 2-bolt anchor with rings.
content.location: This is the original line on the wall, located between Righteous and Indignant and Kung Fu Ain’t Shit. Gray hangers.

content.description: Climb a left leaning dihedral with steaming and liebacking, continue up a tricky face, place a cam in the small roof bulge, move left and up passing one more bolt. Shared anchor with Bowling for Junipers. Lower off.
content.protection: 3 to 4 gear placements in the range of tips to a .75 Camalot, 7 protection bolts. 2-bolt anchor with mussy hooks.
content.location: Located left of Ungracious and Inconsiderate. Obvious left leaning and left facing corner start with 2 bolts.

content.description:
Starts with a thin crack in the back of a left facing flare. Lower off.

A good warm-up for the area however, it would probably feel spicy for a 5.9 climber.
content.protection: tiny to hands. 2-bolt anchor with rings.
content.location: This is the leftmost route on the wall.

content.description: Monkey your way up and behind a large flake, move slightly right and continue up short parallel seams to a ledge. Continue up splitter but flaring finger crack. Use Finger Blast anchor. Rappel from Finger Blast.
content.location: Rightmost route on the wall. Located around the corner from The Mighty Arms of Atlas.

content.description: Fun climbing up interesting water runnel/crack system to a midway crux protected by a single bolt. Continue following the crack system left and then up. Lower off.
content.protection: Gear from fingers to hands, 1 protection bolt. 2-bolt anchor with rings.
content.location: Same start as Finger Blast. First climb right of the “Peace Sign”.

content.description: Climb shallow right facing corner with tricky finger locks up to a roof. Traverse out right under the roof and continue up. Lower off.
content.location: This is the first crack left of the “Peace Sign” route. Starts behind a small juniper.

content.description:
Climbs like three excellent and varied boulder problems. Climb up right leaning seam with 4 bolts to a ramp, continue up intermittent seams and pods with 3 bolts to a rest stance. Another boulder problem protected with 3 bolts guards the top. Lower off.

*Avoid using the large perched block after the 7th bolt.
Shares the same first 5m with Nature Nookie. Climb water groove/crack system, move right at about 5m up, continue up right-leaning finger crack to the anchor. Lower off.
Climb a left leaning diagonal crack then continue up face with 6 bolts. Lower off.
content.protection: tips to hands for the crack, pro is tricky at times, 6 bolts protect the face. 2-bolt anchor with mussy hooks.
content.location: Start near the start of Righteous and Indignant . Shares anchor with Righteous and Indignant.

content.description:
Climb thin face with 3 bolts up to a thin diagonal crack. Traverse the diagonal tips crack with ever thinning footholds, finish the traverse with a tricky mantle, lieback and jam your way to the top. Lower off.

A top-rope can be rigged via Finger Blast.
content.protection: Tiny to 2 inches. There is a hard to see bomber .75 Camalot placement a few moves after the mantle. 3 protection bolts, 2-bolt anchor with rings.
content.location: Starts just to the right of Nature Nookie/Finger Blast with 3 bolts up face.
